title: CVS Health Continues to Move Higher - New Stop Recommendation
text:
We looked at the charts of CVS Health Corp. ( CVS last week, but with Deutsche Bank recommending it today as its top pick we will visit it again this Thursday morning as it's the Real Money 'Stock of the Day'.

Last week we said, "CVS is pointed up but there is a band of resistance around $66 that could get in the way of reaching the Point and Figure target of $73." Let's see if anything has changed.

In this daily bar chart of CVS, below, we can see that prices have crept higher the past week and trading volume looks like it has increased. Technical analysts love to see a stock increase on better volume. The 50-day moving average line is still pointed up and getting closer towards a probable cross of the 200-day line leading to a golden cross buy signal.

The On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line has remained steady and the Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator has moved to a new outright buy signal.

In this updated weekly bar chart of CVS, below, we can see that our favorite indicators have continued to move in the right direction. Prices are above the bottoming 40-week moving average line.

The weekly OBV line is pointed up and the MACD oscillator is close to crossing above the zero line for a buy signal on this longer time frame.

In this Point and Figure chart of CVS, below, we can see one more new high at $63.50 when compared to last week. Our target of $73 is unchanged.

Bottom line strategy: CVS continues to move in the right direction for the bulls. Right below $58 on new or increased long positions.
description: CVS continues to move in the right direction for the bulls....CVS
authors: Cvs Health Continues To Move Higher - New Stop Recommendation
Cvs Continues To Move In The Right Direction For The Bulls.
